locutie.beschrijving: The preacher explores the universal human 'search' for meaning, identity, and security, using the Greeks in John 12 as a biblical archetype. He recounts church history and personal anecdotes about the pulpit inscription 'Sir, we would see Jesus.'
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Moderate. The exegesis is more thematic than analytical, using the text as a springboard for a phenomenology of human longing.

illocutie.beschrijving: The sermon begins with heavy ASSERTING (describing the human condition) but successfully transitions into PROMISING and DECLARING in the final third.
voorbeelden: I confidently predict...
Hear him say: Thy sins are forgiven.
I rest your dearest hope upon the integrity of my word.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To move the hearer from a state of restless searching to a state of rest and security in the person of Christ.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Low. The Spirit is not explicitly mentioned as the agent of the word's efficacy, though the 'name of Jesus' is treated as having inherent power.

voorbeelden: All of life is a search.
These Greeks had found the religion of the Old Testament.
The preacher needed to see that.
Take hold of that.
Get hold of him right there.
Seek ye first the kingdom.
It is a great delight.
I've always felt a great pride.
I yearn that our nation...
I will give you the desires of your heart.
I will come and take you to be with me.
I'll pour out great blessings upon you.
commissieven.kwaliteit: High. The preacher ventriloquizes Christ to deliver direct promises to the congregation.

voorbeelden: Thy sins are forgiven.
Your slate is wiped clean.
Right now, you are a child of God.
declaratieven.autoriteit: Strong. The preacher uses his mandate to declare a change in the hearer's status before God.

indicatoren: Extensive list of life stages (infant, baby, toddler).
Historical details about Michelangelo and King Arthur.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer may feel they are listening to a lecture on human nature rather than an address from God until the final sections.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Excellent. Uses the 'Hear him say' device to bridge the gap between text and hearer.
voorbeelden: I will give you the desires of your heart.
Your account is paid.

tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used heavily in the final declarations of forgiveness and identity.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing the Greeks, the history of the church, and general human types.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a narrative distance that is only bridged in the 'application' phases.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: Generalizations about life as a search.

actueel_present.gebruik: The 'now' of the proclamation: 'Right now, you are a child of God.'

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: The sermon moves from the Assertive (The Greeks' search) to the Declarative (Thy sins are forgiven) to the Commissive (I will come again).
voorbeelden: Carry to Jesus your brokenness... hear him say... Thy sins are forgiven.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: High. The preacher understands that the indicative of grace must precede the imperative of faith.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Because he is the resurrection, you can carry your mortality to him.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: Despite a long constative introduction, the sermon culminates in high-stakes performative language where the preacher speaks in the name of Christ to change the hearer's reality.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: I rest your dearest hope upon the integrity of my word.
sterke_punten.effect: Creates an unshakeable foundation for the hearer.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The long list of developmental stages of searching.
zwakke_punten.probleem: Borderline 'talking about' psychology rather than proclaiming the Gospel.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon becomes an event when the preacher stops talking about the Greeks and starts declaring forgiveness and eternal life to the 'you' in the pews.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The use of 'Thy sins are forgiven' is a pure declarative act.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Yes, through the 'Hear him say' device.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Yes, especially in the pulpit anecdote.
tekstueel_bewijs: The preacher needed to see that! ... We would see Jesus.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Implicitly, through the power of the Name.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: The preacher focuses on the illocution (the promise) and trusts the effect.
tekstueel_bewijs: There is something about this name... that gets down to the heart.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, the word is treated as doing what it says.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: Yes, particularly in the resurrection section.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is heavy on 'to be' and 'to search' (assertives) but finishes strong with 'to forgive' and 'to give' (performatives).

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The middle-aged person searches for security.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: To you who are searching for security in middle age, Christ says: I am your rock.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a general observation to a direct address/promise.

voorbeeldzinnen: Hear him say to your specific fear: I am with you.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: Too much 'we' and 'they' in the first half.
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Use 'you' earlier to implicate the hearer in the search.
voorbeeldzinnen: You are here today because you are searching.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Continue grounding the 'Get hold of him' (Directive) in the 'He is the healer' (Declarative).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in how to transition from a descriptive homily into a sacramental event of proclamation.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' about the pulpit sign; SAT focuses on the 'Declarative' power of the words inscribed on it.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric would praise the Tennyson quote for its pathos; SAT values it only as a foil for the 'Commissive' promise of the Resurrection.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's power isn't in the search imagery, but in the moment the preacher stops describing the search and starts delivering the Goal.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: All of life is a search.

appendices.notities: The preacher uses literary and historical allusions (Michelangelo, Tennyson) as locutionary 'flesh' for the performative 'spirit' of the Gospel.
